Kural_Info.Tamil_Text: யாகாவா ராயினும் நாகாக்க காவாக்கால்சோகாப்பர் சொல்லிழுக்குப் பட்டு.
Kural_Info.English_Meaning: Whatever besides you leave unguarded, guard your tongue; otherwise errors of speech and the consequent misery will ensue.

Layered_Composition.Foreground: A person is shown with their primary focus on guarding their tongue ('நா காக்க'). This is visualized as them gently but firmly holding a lock over their own mouth.
Layered_Composition.Midground: All around them, other aspects of their life are shown unguarded ('யா காவாராயினும்')—their wealth is exposed, their gates are open—but these are shown to be of secondary importance.
Layered_Composition.Background: A contrasting vision shows the terrible consequence of failing to guard the tongue. A single 'slip of the tongue' ('சொல் இழுக்கு') is visualized as a serpent leaping from the mouth, which then turns back and bites the speaker, causing them to be overwhelmed by a dark cloud of sorrow and regret ('சோகாப்பர்').

Art_Direction.Subject_and_Action: The supreme importance of guarding one's tongue above all else, because a slip of the tongue results in immense misery.
Art_Direction.Symbolic_Motifs: The lock on the mouth is a direct symbol of control. The slip of the tongue as a self-biting serpent is a powerful metaphor for the self-inflicted nature of the resulting sorrow.
Art_Direction.Lighting_and_Color: The person guarding their tongue is in a clear, controlled light. The vision of the consequence is dark and chaotic, with the serpent and the cloud of sorrow depicted in sickly, poisonous colors.

Technical_Cues.Camera: A split-screen or a main shot with a clear 'vision bubble' to show both the disciplined act and the dire consequences of failing.
Technical_Cues.Resolution: 8K, ultra-realistic, with a focus on the controlled expression of the disciplined person versus the agonized expression of the one who failed.
Technical_Cues.Lighting: Contrast between the clear light of control and the dark, chaotic light of regret.

Cultural_Anchors: A slip of the tongue (சொல் இழுக்கு)
